comments:
I had a syntax error in my ATL transformation, which wasn't properly reported by
the ADT editor. Instead, it generated a silent error in the background:

java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "'60"

eclipse.buildId=I200406251208
java.version=1.5.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=nl_NL

The rule that triggered this exception was:

rule Operation {
	from s : INMODEL!Operation
	to t : OUTMODEL!Operation mapsTo t (
		name <- s.name,
		owner <- s.owner,
		visibility <- s.visibility,
		ownerScope <- s.ownerScope,
		isAbstract <- s.isAbstract,
		concurrency <- s.concurrency)
}

The "mapsTo t" should have been "mapsTo s".
